Interface ChessBoard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaFXChessBoard, SwingChessBoard

    public interface ChessBoard
    This is the Chessboard interface that is independent of swing and JavaFx

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPiece(ChessPiece piece, int row, int column)
      Adds a piece to this board
      ChessGame getGameRules()
      returns the rules for this game
      ChessPiece getPiece(int row, int column)
      retrieves the piece on a specific location
      boolean hasPiece(int row, int column)
      checks if there is a piece on this location
      ChessPiece removePiece(int row, int column)
      removes a piece in the input location
      boolean squareThreatened(int row, int column, ChessPiece piece)
      returns if a piece is threatened by another one frma different side

    • Method Detail

      • getGameRules

        ChessGame getGameRules()
        returns the rules for this game
        Returns:
        the ChessGame representing the rules

      • addPiece

        void addPiece(ChessPiece piece,
              int row,
              int column)
        Adds a piece to this board
        Parameters:
        piece - the type of piece to add
        row - the row the piece will be added to
        column - the column this piece will be added to

      • removePiece

        ChessPiece removePiece(int row,
                       int column)
        removes a piece in the input location
        Parameters:
        row - the row where the piece is
        column - the column where the piece is
        Returns:
        the piece that was removed

      • hasPiece

        boolean hasPiece(int row,
                 int column)
        checks if there is a piece on this location
        Parameters:
        row - the row to examine
        column - the column to examine
        Returns:
        true if there is a piece, false if there is no piece

      • getPiece

        ChessPiece getPiece(int row,
                    int column)
        retrieves the piece on a specific location
        Parameters:
        row - the row to examine
        column - the column to examine
        Returns:
        the piece that is on that location

      • squareThreatened

        boolean squareThreatened(int row,
                         int column,
                         ChessPiece piece)
        returns if a piece is threatened by another one frma different side
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the piece
        column - the column of the piece
        piece - a piece of the game
